rules: Practice newly learned concepts immediately to integrate them into functional knowledge.
Discuss material with others to solidify understanding.
Teach concepts to others to achieve mastery.
claims: Proactive application of knowledge enhances its integration into functional capabilities.
warnings: Failure to actively practice and integrate knowledge leads to unpreparedness when opportunities arise.

principles: Action and practice are more effective than mere mental preparation.

rules: Practice skills with a partner who provides honest feedback.

Structure practice sessions to align with personal energy cycles (e.g., schedule difficult conversations when motivated).
claims: Incentives significantly improve performance in skill acquisition.
Delaying gratification improves long-term outcomes in personal and professional development.
warnings: Perfectionism can hinder progress by delaying practice.

warnings: Inadequate self-monitoring leads to poor decision outcomes.
Avoid prolonged silence in conflict resolution.
